{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cavernous sinus is a large collection of thin-walled veins creating a cavity bordered by the temporal bone of the skull and the sphenoid bone. It contains several cranial nerves, including the oculomotor nerve (III), the trochlear nerve (IV), the ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve (V1 and V2), and the abducens nerve (VI). Therefore, all the options are correct.", "answer_choice": "A/B/C/D"}
